ratings.comment: Sethares carried my grade in 203 with his explanations on Piazza, despite being in a diff profs section. It was clear that he truly cared about us trying to understand the content. I also appreciate how he took student's criticisms of the structure of the course and made an effort to induce change for future students that take his course. :)

Class was very easy. Not much teaching was done by the professor himself, but he was informational enough and I only had good interactions with him. The class was pretty much just doing projects that were assigned on canvas.

I would highly recommend taking ECE 533 with this professor! His lectures are very informative and entertaining, and the homework and project are challenging but fun. It's a low stress course but you will still learn a lot. I think most students got an A.

Class was just projects with the same partner the entire semester. Choose wisely. Lectures lasted 15 out of 50 mins. Labs usually lasted 20 out of the hour 30 time slot. Lectures were making online diagrams and labs were creating those diagrams in person. It was an easy class and work is do-able during class time. Would 100% recommend.

Best professor i have ever seen. Very helpful for homework and having tons of fun in projects!
Also bill is a very nice professor, you can always get help from him and learn a lot!

Honestly I don't have much of an opinion on Bill because he was only talked at lectures for like 2 minutes and some of the labs. He wasn't even in the videos on Canvas. I can say ECE210 was super easy tho. 
To me it was kind of a weird class. Strange organization and I felt like I learned more about sensors than DC current. Overall enjoyable tho.

ECE 210 was an easy introductory course in electrical engineering. There was a weekly Friday lecture that usually only lasted 15 out of 50 mins. The labs were easy and had setup videos online. Overall, the course was pretty unorganized but it was not difficult so I have no complaints.

He is the nicest guy I have ever met. Very caring and helpful. Although his lectures and his homeworks does not have much links, but his lectures are very enlighting. He is a very talented professor, and we can tell that he knows a lot. The midterm and final project is hard, but the grading is very generous.

Bad lecturer and disorganized material. Homework assignments should be written by Mathematica, which is an awful language... nonintuitive, limited, and hard to pick up. The link between his teaching and homework is weak. You have to be prepared that you will need to learn and complete the boring assignment by yourself.

The class was super easy, but also super disorganized. Students didn't know exam dates until about a week before they took place (excluding the final). While Prof. Sethares did fine teaching the material (material was boring, but can't blame the professor for that), he needs to work on the logistics of the class and communication with students.

For ECE 330 since Moodle is being discontinued we used Canvas for this class instead. Basically the whole class was done using the software Mathematica, and while I think it was a bit too easy, it was a fun and fair class. Bill is a very funny and helpful guy. Exams, while lengthy are take-home and you can use your notes and past work
He's a funny professor, but his lectures are completely useless.
Bill is a good and enthusiastic instructor. His lecture is enjoyable and you can also learn a lot from this. Also the workload is not heavy.

Sethares is a good lecturer and is funny, but his lectures don't help you at all for what you have to do in the class. This class is supposed to teach you Matlab, but does a crummy job of doing so. Take CS 302 before you take this! Also, he aims to get a perfect bell curve so be prepared to get a BC or C.

This Professor was awful and his lectures were useless. He would use slides but would never get into detail about anything. You had to teach yourself from the book in order to do the homework or labs which were both very difficult. The exams were not as difficult but he was a harsh grader giving an average grade of C or BC.
Sethares is a good instructor who knows this subject. He is good and building student interest in the subject. The assignments/projects were instructive and very interesting.

I was interested in signal processing to begin with. So I thought this class was very interesting and easy. However, most of the other students found it REALLY difficult.and I agree that his teaching was not perfectly clear but rather sometimes (often) elusive. I believe the greatest difficult people have in this course was "understanding".

Professor Sethares has a unique teaching style that is a bit informal - he does not follow the textbook or use PowerPoint.  This seemed to make some members of the class uncomfortable as they weren't used to it.  I actually thought it was refreshing.
